channel.title: Experiments on Xing's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Experiments on Xing's Site

item.title: Etiquette of Chatting with the Robot
item.description: More and more websites start to use chatbot in their front page. Mostly it serves as a complimentary to search function on the conventional website.

item.title: Is it the end of the world if $\alpha=0.005$ is new norm?
item.description: How Sample Size is Determined? Is it the end of the world if \(\alpha = 0.005\)? In this paper by Benjamin et al (2017) on redefining statistical significance, they proposed to change the default P-value threshold for statistical significance from 0.05 to 0.005 for claims of new discoveries. That is the proposed p-value is one tenth of the conventional one!! Suppose the world changed to p=0.005. Do we need 10X more sample?
